revised_title: Precise Measurements of Beta-Ray Energies from Radium B and C
tldr: The authors conducted precise measurements of the energies of beta-rays from radium B and C using a magnetic spectrograph. They found that their values agreed closely with those of Rogers for the lines measured by him. The energies were calculated using weighted mean values of e/m and c, and the error in the energies was approximately 1 part in 10^3. This research helped improve the accuracy of determining nuclear levels and energy differences in radium isotopes.
